text: Former flag, used from 1966 to 1986 The flag of Edmonton in Alberta, Canada features the coat of arms on a white square (Canadian pale) surmounting a light blue field. The colors of the flag, white and blue, symbolize peace and water (for the North Saskatchewan River) respectively. The city flag was first approved by Edmonton City Council on 12 December 1966 and was updated in 1986. ==See also== *Coat of arms of Edmonton *Flag of Alberta ==External links== *Edmonton City Symbols - City of Edmonton Website (doc) * Flag Category:Flags of cities in Alberta Edmonton Category:Flags introduced in 1966 Category:Flags introduced in 1986
title: Flag of Edmonton
